avdta.network.node.policy

Class IntersectionPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.node.policy.IntersectionPolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<Vehicle>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuctionPolicy, FCFSPolicy, FIFOPolicy, MCKSPriority, PhasePriority, TransitFirst

    public abstract class IntersectionPolicy
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<Vehicle>
    An abstract prioritization of vehicles in reservation controls. This class also contains instantiations of commonly used policies and objectives. There is no need to create distinct policies or objectives for each intersection.

      • initialize

        public abstract void initialize(TBR node,
                                Vehicle vehicle)
        Initializes Vehicle priority for the specified Node and Vehicle
        Parameters:
        node - the intersection at which the Vehicle is waiting.
        vehicle - the Vehicle to be initialized

      • compare

        public abstract int compare(Vehicle v1,
                            Vehicle v2)
        Compares two Vehicles according to their reservation priority. Vehicles are listed in order of decreasing priority.
        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator<Vehicle>
        Parameters:
        v1 - the first vehicle being compared
        v2 - the second vehicle being compared
        Returns:
        sorting index for vehicles

      • onAccept

        public void onAccept(Vehicle v)
        Any actions taken when the Vehicle's reservation is accepted.
        Parameters:
        v - the Vehicle with an accepted reservation

      • usesVehiclesBehind

        public boolean usesVehiclesBehind()
        To use the list of vehicles waiting behind, set this to return true, then use initialize() method
        Returns:
        false

      • initialize

        public void initialize(TBR node,
                       Vehicle vehicle,
                       java.util.List<Vehicle> queue)
        Initializes vehicle priority using a list of vehicles behind. See usesVehiclesBehind() to activate this
        Parameters:
        node - the Node this priority applies to
        vehicle - the Vehicle this priority applies to
        queue - the List of sending flow on the vehicles
